similarTechnologies: When you visit or log in to our website, cookies and similar technologies may be used by our online data partners or vendors to associate these activities with other personal information they or others have about you, including by association with your email or home address. We (or service providers on our behalf) may then send communications and marketing to these email or home addresses. You may opt out of receiving this advertising by visiting
rightsPolicyApplies: La política de Derechos Humanos de NETSOL se aplica a todos los empleados de Netsol y se basa en los siguientes principios clave:
businessLawfully: Realizamos todas nuestras actividades comerciales de forma legal en todas las comunidades a las que servimos y de una manera que respete y promueva los derechos humanos y la igualdad para todos los empleados, personal de agencias y proveedores, independientemente de su ubicación.
fundamentalHumanRight: El reconocimiento y respeto del derecho humano fundamental a que los empleados/las personas lleven una vida digna e independiente, libres de abusos, violaciones y cualquier forma de discriminación.
recognitionThatPeoples: El reconocimiento de que los derechos humanos de las personas pueden verse afectados directa e indirectamente por las operaciones, productos y servicios de la empresa, y la adopción de medidas para identificar y reducir, en la medida de lo posible, el impacto negativo de la empresa en las comunidades y el medio ambiente.
responsibleOrganization: El deseo de actuar como una organización responsable para lograr un conjunto común de normas aplicables a todos los pueblos y naciones, en el compromiso con la mejora social y económica continua.
opposeAndProhibit: Nos oponemos y prohibimos el uso de la trata de personas, el trabajo infantil, la esclavitud y el trabajo forzoso, y exigimos lo mismo a todos nuestros socios comerciales y proveedores. Como empresa global, la Compañía está comprometida con el cumplimiento de la Carta Internacional de Derechos Humanos y tanto de la legislación laboral aplicable como de las leyes específicas de derechos humanos, como la Ley contra la Esclavitud Moderna del Reino Unido.
contractualRelations: El compromiso de procurar entablar relaciones contractuales únicamente con terceros que demuestren el deseo de aplicar principios similares a los anteriores a través de sus propios marcos e iniciativas.
successfulImplementation: NETSOL reconoce que la implementación exitosa de nuestra Política de Derechos Humanos está fuertemente influenciada por la cooperación y el apoyo de nuestras cadenas de suministro.
suppliersOrContractors: Si los proveedores o contratistas actúan de manera incompatible con nuestra Política de Derechos Humanos y/o son cómplices de cualquier abuso contra los derechos humanos, NETSOL buscará rescindir sus contratos y poner fin a todas las relaciones comerciales con ellos.
transparencyStatement: Declaración de transparencia de la Ley sobre la esclavitud moderna
acknowledgesInternationally: NetSol Technologies, Inc. («Netsol») reconoce los derechos humanos proclamados internacionalmente y está plenamente comprometida con la lucha contra la esclavitud y la trata de personas. Diseñamos, desarrollamos, comercializamos y exportamos software propio a clientes de los sectores de financiación y arrendamiento de automóviles, banca y servicios financieros en todo el mundo. Asimismo, ofrecemos servicios de integración de sistemas, consultoría y productos y servicios de TI a cambio de honorarios.
majorityOwnedSubsidiaries: Contamos con diez filiales de nuestra propiedad al 100% y seis filiales participadas mayoritariamente en todo el mundo, incluyendo el Reino Unido, y nuestra empresa matriz está constituida en Estados Unidos. NETSOL tiene más de 1400 empleados fijos en todo el mundo.
humanRightsPolicyDescription: La Política de Derechos Humanos de NetSol reconoce los derechos humanos internacionales consagrados en la Carta de Derechos Humanos. Nuestra política refleja nuestras responsabilidades en materia de esclavitud y trata de personas.
dueDiligenceSlavery: Nuestras políticas y diligencia debida en materia de esclavitud y trata de personas:
committedToEnsuring: Nos comprometemos a garantizar que no exista esclavitud moderna ni trata de personas en nuestras cadenas de suministro ni en ninguna parte de nuestra actividad. Como empresa de software y servicios, no contamos con una base de fabricación ni una cadena de suministro de bienes tangibles. Por consiguiente, creemos que la probabilidad de que exista esclavitud o trata de personas en nuestra cadena de suministro es muy baja. Sin embargo, nuestra empresa se compromete a promover y proteger los derechos humanos en todos los lugares donde operamos. Esperamos que nuestros proveedores y demás socios comerciales se comprometan con una conducta ética, cumplan con todas las leyes y normativas aplicables y tomen medidas para promover la erradicación de la trata de personas y la esclavitud. Seguiremos colaborando con nuestros proveedores y perfeccionando nuestros propios requisitos y procesos para reforzar nuestro compromiso con los derechos humanos y una cultura de conducta ética, integridad y respeto.
pursuantToSection: Esta declaración se realiza de conformidad con la sección 54(1) de la Ley de Esclavitud Moderna de 2015 y constituye la declaración de nuestra Compañía sobre esclavitud y trata de personas para el ejercicio económico que finaliza el 30 de junio de 2024.
cookiesAreSmall: Cookies are small pieces of data sent from a website and stored on the user’s web browser while the user is browsing. Cookies don’t identify you as an individual, they simply collect statistical data about your browsing activities. By using Cookies, We are able to provide you with a better experience and to improve our site by better understanding how you use it. Please read this Cookie Policy carefully and ensure that you understand it. Your acceptance of Our Cookie Policy is deemed to occur if you continue using our site. If you do not agree to Our Cookie Policy, please stop using Our Site immediately.
siteUseCookies: How Does Our Site Use Cookies?
placeAndAccess: Our site may place and access certain first party Cookies on your computer or device. First party Cookies are those placed directly by us and are used only by us. We use Cookies to facilitate and improve your experience of our site and to provide and improve our products and services. We have carefully chosen these Cookies and have taken steps to ensure that your privacy and personal data is protected and respected at all times. By using our site, you may also receive certain third party Cookies on your computer or device. Third party cookies are those placed by websites, services, and/or parties other than us. Third party Cookies are used on our Site for analysing usage of our website.
accordanceWithCurrent: All cookies used by and on our site are used in accordance with current Cookie Law. We may use some or all of the following types of cookie:
strictlyNecessary: Strictly Necessary Cookies -A cookie falls into this category if it is essential to the operation of our site, supporting functions such as logging in, your shopping basket, and payment transactions.
analyticsCookies: Analytics Cookies –It is important for us to understand how you use our site, for example, how efficiently you are able to navigate around it, and what features you use. Analytics cookies enable us to gather this information, helping us to improve our site and your experience of it
functionalityCookies: Functionality Cookies –Enable us to provide additional functions to you on our site such as personalisation and remembering your saved preferences. Some functionality cookies may also be strictly necessary cookies, but not all necessarily fall into that category.
thirdPartyCookies: Third Party Cookies –These are not placed by us; instead, they are placed by third parties that provide services to us and/or to you. Third party cookies may be used by advertising services to serve up tailored advertising to you on our site, or by third parties providing analytics services to us (these cookies will work in the same way as analytics cookies described above)
persistentCookies: Persistent Cookies –Any of the above types of cookie may be a persistent cookie. Persistent Cookies are those which remain on your computer or device for a predetermined period and are activated each time you visit our site.
sessionCookies: Session Cookies –Any of the above types of cookie may be a session cookie. Session cookies are temporary and only remain on your computer or device from the point at which you visit our site until you close your browser. Session cookies are deleted when you close your browser.
permanentAndWill: Cookies on our site are not permanent and will expire as indicated in the table below.
detailsofThePersonal: For more details of the personal data that We collect and use, the measures we have in place to protect personal data, your legal rights, and our legal obligations, please refer to our Privacy Policy.
specificDetails: For more specific details of the cookies that we use, please refer to the table below.
cookiesDoes: What Cookies Does Our Site Use?
firstPartyCookies: The following first party cookies may be placed on your computer or device:
UsesGoogleAnalytics: Our site uses Google Analytics. Website analytics refers to a set of tools used to collect and analyse anonymous usage information, enabling us to better understand how our site is used. This, in turn, enables us to improve Our Site and the products and services offered through it. You do not have to allow Us to use these Cookies, however whilst our use of them does not pose any risk to your privacy or your safe use of our site, it does enable us to continually improve our site, making it a better and more useful experience for you.
requiredInformation: The analytics service(s) used by our site use(s) analytics cookies to gather the required information.
analyticsCookiesText: The analytics service(s) used by our site use(s) the following analytics cookies:
throttleRequest: Used to throttle request rate. If Google Analytics is deployed via Google Tag Manager, this cookie will be named _dc_gtm_.
campaignRelatedInformation: Contains campaign related information for the user. If you have linked your Google Analytics and AdWords accounts, AdWords website conversion tags will read this cookie unless you opt-out.
whenVisiting: When visiting our site you will be shown a pop-up informing you of our use of cookies. By continuing to use our site you are giving your consent to the placing of cookies on your device enabling us to provide the best possible experience and service to you. You may, if you wish, deny consent to the placing of cookies unless those cookies are strictly necessary; however certain features of our site may not function fully or as intended. You can return to your cookie preferences to review and/or change them at any time by resetting your cookie preferences in your browser.
additionTheControls: In addition to the controls that we provide, you can choose to enable or disable cookies in your internet browser. Most internet browsers also enable you to choose whether you wish to disable all cookies or only third party cookies. By default, most internet browsers accept cookies but this can be changed. For further details, please consult the help menu in your internet browser or the documentation that came with your device.
cookiesUsed: All cookies used by and on our site are used in accordance with current Cookie Law. We may use some or all of the following types of cookie:
specificInstructions: (Please note that there are no specific instructions at this time, but Microsoft support will be able to assist)
androidTextLink: https://support.google.com/chrome/answer/95647?co=GENIE.Platform%3DAndroidandhl=en (Please refer to your device’s documentation for manufacturers’ own browsers)
cookiePolicyText: We may alter this cookie policy at any time. Any such changes will become binding on you on your first use of our site after the changes have been made. You are therefore advised to check this page from time to time.
conflictbetween: In the event of any conflict between the current version of this cookie policy and any previous version(s), the provisions current and in effect shall prevail unless it is expressly stated otherwise.
categoriesOfPersonal: Categories of Personal Information We Collect:
californiaConsumerPrivacy: The California Consumer Privacy Act (“CCPA”) obliges us to reveal certain information regarding categories of personal info that we collect. We gather the listed categories of personal information (subject to applicable legal requirements and restrictions):
contactInformation: Name, contact information and other identifiers: identifiers such as a name, phone number, email address, online identifier, IP address, government-issued identification numbers or other similar identifiers.
geolocationInformation: Geolocation information: geographic location information about a particular user or device.
professionalOrEmployment: Employment data: professional or employment-related information.
categoriesOfPersonalDesc: CCPA requires that we disclose the categories of personal information that we may reveal for a commercial purpose. In general, we may disclose the following categories of personal information in support of our business purposes identified above:
contactInformationText: Name, contact information and other identifiers
providesInformation: This section provides information for California residents as per the California Consumer Privacy Act (“CCPA”), that obliges us to provide residents of California specific information regarding how we manage their personal information, online or offline. However, this section does not address or apply to our management of publicly available information which is made legally available by state or federal governments or other personal information that is subject to an exemption under the CCPA.
californiaResidentsDesc: California Residents' Rights. California residents have been granted particular rights by the California law and imposes restrictions on certain business practices as mentioned below.
personalInformation: Do-not-sell: California residents have the right to opt-out of the sale of their personal information. If you are a California resident, you can submit an opt-out request here. We do not sell personal information about residents who we know are younger than 16 years old without opt-in consent.
noticeBefore: Notice before collection: We are required to notify California residents, at or before the point of collection of their personal information, the categories of personal information collected and the purposes for which such information is used.
requestToDelete: Request to delete: California residents have the right to request, at no charge, deletion of their personal information that we have collected about them and to have such personal information deleted, except where an exemption applies. We will respond to verifiable requests received from California residents as required by law.
requestToKnow: Request to know: California residents have the right to request and, subject to certain exemptions, receive a copy of the specific pieces of personal information that we have collected about them in the prior 12 months and to have this delivered, free of charge, either (a) by mail or (b) electronically in a portable and, to the extent technically feasible, readily useable format that allows the individual to transmit this information to another entity without hindrance. California residents also have the right to request that we provide them certain information about how we have handled their personal information in the prior 12 months, including:
sourcesOfPersonal: categories of sources of personal information;
commercialPurposes: business and/or commercial purposes for collecting and selling their personal information;
thirdParties: categories of third parties/with whom we have disclosed or shared their personal information;
personalInformationDesc: categories of personal information that we have disclosed or shared with a third party for a business purpose; and
categoriesOfThird: categories of third parties to whom the residents' personal information has been sold and the specific categories of personal information sold to each category of third party.
requestToKnowDesc: California residents may make a Request to Know up to twice every 12 months, at no charge. We will respond to verifiable requests received from California residents as required by law.
discriminationDesc: Discrimination and financial incentives: The CCPA prohibits discrimination against California residents for exercising their rights under the CCPA. A business may offer financial incentives for the collection, sale or deletion of California residents’ personal information, where the incentive is not unjust, unreasonable, coercive or usurious, and is made available in compliance with applicable transparency, informed consent, and opt-out requirements. California residents have the right to be notified of any financial incentive offers and their material terms, the right to opt-out of such incentives at any time, and may not be included in such incentives without their prior informed opt-in consent. We do not offer any such incentives at this time.
requestsToKnow: Requests to Know and Requests to Delete may be submitted:
informationAbout: For more information about our privacy practices, contact us as mentioned above.
requestToKnowText: REQUEST TO KNOW AND REQUEST TO DELETE PAGE:
withoutAnyCharges: California residents (few exemptions) have the right to request the following without any charges;
collectedAbout: Request to delete: California residents can request deletion of their personal information that we collected about them.
certainPieces: Request to know: California residents can request and obtain a copy of certain pieces of personal information that we collected12 months prior about them. They can also request us to provide information how we handled the personal data about them 12 months prior to request.
informationCollected: categories and sources of personal information collected:
collectingAndSelling: business or commercial purposes for collecting and selling their personal information:
disclosedTheirPersonal: categories of third parties to whom we have disclosed their personal information for a business purpose;
personalInformationText: categories of personal information that we have disclosed to a third party for a business purpose;
specificCategories: categories of third parties to whom the residents' personal information has been sold and the specific categories of personal information sold to each category.
knowPerYear: You may submit up to two requests to know per year.
